description: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is a style sheet language used for describing the look and formatting of a document written in HTML. It controls the layout, colors, and fonts of web pages, enhancing the visual presentation.
A utility-first CSS framework that makes it easy to design and build modern and responsive user interfaces. It provides low-level utility classes to construct designs directly in your markup.

A popular front-end framework that includes HTML, CSS, and JavaScript components for building responsive and mobile-first web projects. It simplifies the process of web development with pre-designed components and styles.

A versatile programming language commonly used for building interactive and dynamic websites. It runs on the client side and allows developers to add functionality, validate forms, and manipulate the DOM.
A JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It allows developers to create reusable UI components for building efficient and maintainable web applications.

Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is a style sheet language used for describing the look and formatting of a document written in HTML. It controls the layout, colors, and fonts of web pages, enhancing the visual presentation.
